moves.1. c4 e5 2. g3: after c4, e5, Nc3, Nf6, g3, we enter the Carls' Bremen system: after that, d5 would lead to some kind of a reversed Dragon; Bb4 to the Smyslov system...
moves.2... Nf6 3. Bg2: or Nc3, d5, cxd5, Nxd5, Bg2...
moves.3... Bc5: the similarities with a reversed Sicilian are unmistakable...
moves.4. e3: followed by Ne2, and 0-0, and then d4, this is fine: in this case, White is preparing a too early d4: better Nc3, 0-0, Nf3, and try to get back on track...
moves.7... Qe7+: after 0-0, c5, Bg4, f3, Bf5, Nge2, White has better chances to regroup...
moves.8. Nge2 dxc4 9. O-O O-O 10. Bg5 c6 11. N: considering Whites' next possibility, maybe Ba5, Qa4, Bb6, would have been better...
moves.13. Qc2: missing the very strong and thematic f4, h6, Bh4: now, Black gets out better...
moves.13... h6 14. Nxd6 Qxd6 15. Bf4 Qe6 16. R: practically forced: after Nc3?, Qxe1+, Rxe1, Rxe1+, Bf1, Bh3, all is over...
moves.18... Nfd5: Black is getting the upper hand, entering the middle game: Nd5 will prove to be very dangerous...
moves.19. Kf1: not paying attention, to Blacks' upcoming threats: best was Be4, to avoid the next move...
moves.19... Qf5: with the White King on f1, Ne3+, is suddenly a deadly threat: this will force trading Queens in a won position for Black...
moves.20. Nc3: the only one: after Qxf5, Bxf5, Nc3, Rad8, Bf3, f6, Black is winning...
moves.20... Qxc2 21. Rxc2 Bf5 22. Be4: not good: toughest is Rcc1, Rad8, Bxd5, Nxd5, Kg2, Ne7, f3, f6, Bf4...
moves.22... Bh3+: this unmasks 19. Kf1, as the losing move...
moves.23. Kg1 f6 24. Nxd5: weak and losing: better Bd6, Nxc3, Rxc3...
moves.24... cxd5 25. Bg6 Re6 26. f4 fxe5 27. f: White did not succeed in setting up a decisive attack: Black is winning...
moves.32. Rc7 Nc4 33. Rcf7 Rxf7 34. gxf7+ Kf8: toughest is Kf2, Bf5, Rc1, d3, Rxc3, d2, Rxc4...
moves.36... Bf5: after Rc1, c2, g4, d3!, gxf5, d2, Rf1, d1Q, all is over: so White resigned...
